ClinicalDocument.title: Department of Veterans Affairs Health Summary

text.paragraph: This section contains Allergies on record with VA for the patient. The data comes from all VA treatment facilities. It does not list allergies that were removed or entered in error. Some allergies may be reported in the Immunization section.

This section contains inpatient and outpatient Vital Signs on record at VA for the patient. The data comes from all VA treatment facilities. It includes 12 months of data, with a maximum of the 10 most recent sets of vitals. If more than one set of vitals was taken on the same date, only the most recent set is populated for that date.
text.content: Vital Sign Observation Text Not Available

text.paragraph: This section contains a list of Problems/Conditions known to VA for the patient. It includes both active and inactive problems/conditions. The data comes from all VA treatment facilities.

td.content: Diseases due to Viruses and Chlamydiae, other Specified Viral Warts (ICD-9-CM 078.19)

section.title: Medications Section
section.text: No Data Provided for This Section

text.paragraph: This section contains a list of completed VA Outpatient Encounters for the patient and a list of Discharge Summaries, Consult Notes, and History & Physical Notes for the patient. The data comes from all VA treatment facilities.

The list of VA Outpatient Encounters shows the 150 most recent Encounter dates within the last 36 months. Each VA Outpatient Encounter may also include several notes with the complete note text. There is a limit of 10 notes for each Encounter. Follow-up visits related to the VA Encounter are not included. The data comes from all VA treatment facilities.

CARDIOLOGY PROCEDURE REPORT : LOCAL TITLE: CARDIOLOGY PROCEDURE ECHOCARDIOGRAM STANDARD TITLE: CARDIOLOGY PROCEDURE REPORT DATE OF NOTE: MAR 06, 2015@15:37:17 ENTRY DATE: MAR 06, 2015@15:37:17 AUTHOR: CLINICAL,DEVICE PRO EXP COSIGNER: URGENCY: STATUS: COMPLETED
PROCEDURE SUMMARY CODE: Machine Resulted DATE/TIME PERFORMED: MAR 06, 2015@10:37:4
** DOCUMENT IN VISTA IMAGING ** SEE FULL REPORT IN VISTA IMAGING
SIGNATURE NOT REQUIRED SEE SIGNATURE IN VISTA IMAGING
** (Xcelera Echo ADULT) AUTO-INSTRUMENT DIAGNOSIS **
Procedure: Adult
+-----------+ : : : :VA Medical Center Division of Cardiology : :Atlanta, state91 1670 Clairmont Road : : Decatur, state91 30033 +-----------+ Transthoracic Echocardiogram Report
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --+ :Name: LN91, FN91 MN91Study Date: 03/06/2015 10:37 AM : :MRN: SSN91 Patient Location: ATL CARDIO-ECHO PM : :DOB: DOB91 Gender: Male Height: 73 in : :Age: 25 yrs Weight: 160 lb : :Reason For Study: Evaluate LV function BSA: 2.0 meter s2: +---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --+ Examination: Comprehensive 2D transthoracic echocardiogram with M-mode, spectral/colorflow/tissue Doppler was performed (93306).
Interpretation Summary The study was technically adequate. There is no comparison study available. Normal transthoracic echocardiogram.
Left Ventricle The left ventricle is normal in size. There is normal left ventricular wall thickness. Left ventricular systolic function is normal. Ejection Fraction = 60-65%. The left ventricular diastolic function appears to be normal. The left ventricular wall motion is normal.
Right Ventricle The right ventricle is normal in size and function.
Atria The left atrial size is normal. Right atrial size is normal. The inferior vena cava diameter is normal with normal respiratory variation.
Mitral Valve The mitral valve leaflets appear normal. There is no mitral regurgitation noted.
Tricuspid Valve The tricuspid valve appears structurally normal. There is trace tricuspid regurgitation. Doppler findings do not suggest pulmonary hypertension.
Aortic Valve The aortic valve is normal in structure and function. No aortic regurgitation is present.
Pulmonic Valve The pulmonic valve leaflets are thin and pliable; valve motion is normal. Trace pulmonic valvular regurgitation.
Great Vessels The aortic root is normal size.
Pericardium/Pleural There is no pericardial effusion.
_____________________________________________________________________________ __
Attending Physician: Jason P Linefsky 03/06/2015 09:37 PM Referring Physician: HALL, GAIRY F Performed By: Alan Carter
Administrative Closure: 03/06/2015 by: DEVICE PROXY SERVICE CLINICAL Clinical,Device Proxy Service

PHYSICIAN LETTERS : LOCAL TITLE: TEST RESULTS NOTIFICATION STANDARD TITLE: PHYSICIAN LETTERS DATE OF NOTE: MAR 09, 2015@17:28 ENTRY DATE: MAR 09, 2015@17:28:31 AUTHOR: HALL,GAIRY F EXP COSIGNER: URGENCY: STATUS: COMPLETED
Patient notified via letter:
March 9, 2015
FN91 LN91 street91 city91, state91 zip91
Dear Mr. LN91:
I am writing to give you results from your tests on 03/09/2015.
Your echocardiogram showed normal function of the heart muscle. The ejectrion fraction, with is the percent of blood in the heart pumped with each beat, was normal. Normal is over 50%. The strctureand valves were also normal.
Sincerely:
Gairy Hall, MD

NURSING TRIAGE NOTE : LOCAL TITLE: NURSING OUTPT TRIAGE INTAKE NOTE STANDARD TITLE: NURSING TRIAGE NOTE DATE OF NOTE: DEC 01, 2014@14:43 ENTRY DATE: DEC 01, 2014@14:43:51 AUTHOR: JONES,GWENDOLYN HAR EXP COSIGNER: URGENCY: STATUS: COMPLETED
*** NURSING OUTPT TRIAGE INTAKE NOTE Has ADDENDA ***
Have you traveled outside of the US or in areas that currently have Ebola cases? "NO." The incubation period and quarantine is normally 2-21 days, but it is not 100% protective, cases were detected 30 days after exposure-so for safe side-must be 30 days. Virus also seen in semen within 3months (people who survived), so must have protective sex for at least 3m.
SIGN/SYMPTOMS-cough, fever, malaise, muscle ache, joint ache, lethargy, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea (1st week, after few days), Second week-terminal-bleeding episodes-particularly GI bleeding.
RETURN VISIT: PERMITTED TO LEAVE MESSAGES WITH FN91 LN91/MOTHER; TAMMY SAN NICOLAS/GIRLFRIEND
PATIENT AGE: 25
CHIEF COMPLAINT: NO COMPLAINTS OR ANY ACUTE CHANGES IN CONDITION NOTED.

EMERGENCY DEPT NOTE : LOCAL TITLE: ED-BOILERPLATE STANDARD TITLE: EMERGENCY DEPT NOTE DATE OF NOTE: OCT 25, 2014@20:53 ENTRY DATE: OCT 25, 2014@20:53:47 AUTHOR: ABUTALEB,AMEER O EXP COSIGNER: GRASSO,MICHAEL A URGENCY: STATUS: COMPLETED
*** ED-BOILERPLATE Has ADDENDA ***
TIME SEEN: 2053 CHIEF COMPLAINT: "passed out" HPI:
This is a lovely 25yo male who presents after losing consciousness at a Christening
He was in his uusal state of health, had some chicken soup this morning, and went to a Christening. It was a hot room which was very crowded. During the ceremonies, he felt his legs getting numb, then his body getting really hot, his heart racing, then he started to lose his vision and he blacked out. His mother was with him and she accounts that he faceplanted onto the table with all the food then to the floor. He lost conscoiusness for two minutes. Then he woke up and felt completely fine. The mother was very worried because his fall was quite dramatic, but he had no injuries that she could tell. They then presented to the ED.
He had no confusion, tongue biting, or loss of bowel or bladder control. He doesnt drink any water at all only tea and juice. He had a beer before he passed out. He has sickle cell trait.
PMH:
Sickle cell trait
PSurgHx: Elbow surgery for trapped nerve.
Medications: none
Allergies: NKDA
ROS: see HPI
PHYSICAL EXAM Vital Signs: TEMP: 98.2 F [36.8 C] (10/25/2014 20:19) PULSE: 82 (10/25/2014 20:19) RESP RATE: 16 (10/25/2014 20:19) PULSE OX: BP: 135/78 (10/25/2014 20:19) Pain Score(scale 0-10): 0 Is patient satisfied with pain score:[x ]yes [ ]no General: Pleasant 25yo male in NAD
HEENT: [x ]Normal exam
Cardiovascular: [x ]Regular, normal rate, no murmurs, rubs or gallops
Lungs: [x ]Clear bilaterally
Abdomen: [ x]Soft, flat, nontender, normal bowel sounds
Extremity exam: [x ] no cyanosis, clubbing or edema
Neuro: [x ]alert, oriented to person, place time; cranial nerves 2-7 intact by exam; normal gait; normal deep tendon reflexes bilaterally; no sensory deficits
Skin:[x ] Normal exam
LAB DATA: INVALID LRDFN - CANNOT ACCESS LAB DATA
ECG: normal sinus rhythm biatrial enlargement possible LVH
ED COURSE: Cardiology [Time Discussed]:
MEDICATION RECONCILIATION in the EMERGENCY DEPT: [x ] I have reviewed the patient's outpatient medications, herbals, over-the-counters, dietary supplements, and non-VA medications and reconciled them with the medications ordered in the Emergency Department.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN:
25yo male with prodromal symptoms preceding syncope, likely vasovagal syncope.
# Syncope - EKG to evaluate for any abberancy (WPW) - Consider ECHO (HOCM) - PCP follow up.
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS: vasovagal syncope
Discharge Instructions provided to patient: [x ] Yes Condition of patient on Discharge: [x ] Stable [ ] Unchanged
FOLLOW-UP:[ ] none needed [x ] with PCP

PATIENT INSTRUCTIONS:
You were seen in the VA emergency room for passing out. We think you had something called vasovagal syncope. Please drink plenty of water. We scheduled you for a heart scan to make sure there is nothing abnormal in your heart. We also put a consult in for you to have a primary care doctor.

PHYSICIAN LETTERS : LOCAL TITLE: TEST RESULTS NOTIFICATION STANDARD TITLE: PHYSICIAN LETTERS DATE OF NOTE: APR 14, 2014@10:25 ENTRY DATE: APR 14, 2014@10:26:05 AUTHOR: HALL,GAIRY F EXP COSIGNER: URGENCY: STATUS: COMPLETED
Patient notified via letter:
April 14, 2014
FN91 LN91 Po Box 1103 Conyers, state91 30012-1103
Dear Mr. LN91:
I am writing to give you results from your tests on 04/08/2014.
Your blood sugar, which checks for diabetes, was 69, which is in the normal range. Normal is below 110.
Your Urinalysis was normal and your culture did NOT grow any bacteria.
If you see other physicians that may be interested in your results, the numbers for some of the key labs are: Hgb 16, Hct 44.7, Plts 173, Na 140, K 4.1, Ca 9.9, Cr 0.86, BUN 11, ALT 19, AST 23, T.Bili 0.7.
The following tests were all normal: Renal & Liver Function, Potassium, Calcium, Sodium, White Blood Cells, Platelets.
The RPR test for syphilis was negative. This test is done to check for infection with syphillis at any time in the past, and is often included in screening for sexually transmitted diseases.
The GC/Chlamydia test to check for gonorrhea and chlamydia were negative. This culture is done to check for evidence of these sexually transmitted diseases. Even though the tests were negative, I would recommend that you complete the antibiotics since you were potentially exposed, and the germ may have been in too early a stage to show on the test.
The blood test for HIV was negative. This means that there are no antibodies to HIV in your blood, and you can safely assume that exposure to an individual more than 6 months ago poses no risk to you. If you are concerned about a potential recent exposure, retesting in 6 months after the last exposure to the individual is the best way to be certain you haven't been exposed to HIV.
Your Hemoglobin Electro phoresis confirms that you have Sickle Cell Trait.
Your future appointments are as follows: 04/16/2014 09:00 STK PC-HALL
Sincerely:
Gairy Hall, MD

text.paragraph: This section contains the Chemistry and Hematology Lab Results, Radiology Reports, and Pathology Reports on record with VA for the patient. The data comes from all VA treatment facilities.

tr.td: The included Chemistry/Hematology Results are from the last 24 months and are limited to the 20 most recent sets of tests. The data comes form all VA treatment facilities.

td.content: Specimen Type: SERUM Comment: Test Performed by Quest, Chantilly, Quest Diagnostics Nichols Institute, 14225 Newbrook Drive, Chantilly, VA 20151 Kenneth Sisco, M.D., Ph.D., Director of Laboratories (703) 802-6900, CLIA 49D0221801 Ordering Provider: Ebere N Okeke md Report Released Date/Time: Apr 22, 2014@13:55 Performing Lab: QUEST/AML 14225 NEWBROOK DRIVE CHANTILLY, VA 20153-0841

Specimen Type: BLOOD Comment: On high-pressure liquid chromatography (HPLC), there can be a falsely elevated HbA2 due to coelution of minor components of the variant hemoglobin in the A2 peak. For more information on this test, go to: http://education.questdiagnostics.com/faq/FAQ99v1 S TRAIT* By high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC), there are two peaks, one is HbA, the other peak is in the S window. The sickle solubility test is positive. Sickle cell trait usually is not regarded as a disease state because the vast majority of individuals are asymptomatic. People with uncomplicated sickle cell trait have a normal CBC, reticulocyte count, and red cell morphology. The main clinical significance of sickle cell trait is in counseling prospective parents. This is because of the possibility of sickle cell anemia or disease if one parent has sickle cell trait and the other parent also has sickle cell trait or other hemoglobinopathy that interacts with HbS. If microcytosis is present, the patient may also be a carrier for alpha thalassemia and the percentage of HbS is usually less than 35% * This interpretation assumes the patient has not been transfused in the past three months. Results were reviewed and interpreted by Qing Yan Liu, M.D. If additional information is needed, please call 1-703-802-7243. Test Performed by Quest, Chantilly, Quest Diagnostics Nichols Institute, 14225 Newbrook Drive, Chantilly, VA 20151 Kenneth Sisco, M.D., Ph.D., Director of Laboratories (703) 802-6900, CLIA 49D0221801 Ordering Provider: Gairy F Hall MD Report Released Date/Time: Apr 14, 2014@08:55 Performing Lab: QUEST/AML 14225 NEWBROOK DRIVE CHANTILLY, VA 20153-0841

CARDIOLOGY PROCEDURE REPORT : LOCAL TITLE: CARDIOLOGY PROCEDURE ECHOCARDIOGRAM STANDARD TITLE: CARDIOLOGY PROCEDURE REPORT DATE OF NOTE: MAR 06, 2015@15:37:17 ENTRY DATE: MAR 06, 2015@15:37:17 AUTHOR: CLINICAL,DEVICE PRO EXP COSIGNER: URGENCY: STATUS: COMPLETED
PROCEDURE SUMMARY CODE: Machine Resulted DATE/TIME PERFORMED: MAR 06, 2015@10:37:4
** DOCUMENT IN VISTA IMAGING ** SEE FULL REPORT IN VISTA IMAGING
SIGNATURE NOT REQUIRED SEE SIGNATURE IN VISTA IMAGING
** (Xcelera Echo ADULT) AUTO-INSTRUMENT DIAGNOSIS **
Procedure: Adult
+-----------+ : : : :VA Medical Center Division of Cardiology : :Atlanta, state91 1670 Clairmont Road : : Decatur, state91 30033 +-----------+ Transthoracic Echocardiogram Report
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --+ :Name: LN91, FN91 MN91Study Date: 03/06/2015 10:37 AM : :MRN: SSN91 Patient Location: ATL CARDIO-ECHO PM : :DOB: DOB91 Gender: Male Height: 73 in : :Age: 25 yrs Weight: 160 lb : :Reason For Study: Evaluate LV function BSA: 2.0 meter s2: +---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --+ Examination: Comprehensive 2D transthoracic echocardiogram with M-mode, spectral/colorflow/tissue Doppler was performed (93306).
Interpretation Summary The study was technically adequate. There is no comparison study available. Normal transthoracic echocardiogram.
Left Ventricle The left ventricle is normal in size. There is normal left ventricular wall thickness. Left ventricular systolic function is normal. Ejection Fraction = 60-65%. The left ventricular diastolic function appears to be normal. The left ventricular wall motion is normal.
Right Ventricle The right ventricle is normal in size and function.
Atria The left atrial size is normal. Right atrial size is normal. The inferior vena cava diameter is normal with normal respiratory variation.
Mitral Valve The mitral valve leaflets appear normal. There is no mitral regurgitation noted.
Tricuspid Valve The tricuspid valve appears structurally normal. There is trace tricuspid regurgitation. Doppler findings do not suggest pulmonary hypertension.
Aortic Valve The aortic valve is normal in structure and function. No aortic regurgitation is present.
Pulmonic Valve The pulmonic valve leaflets are thin and pliable; valve motion is normal. Trace pulmonic valvular regurgitation.
Great Vessels The aortic root is normal size.
Pericardium/Pleural There is no pericardial effusion.
_____________________________________________________________________________ __
Attending Physician: Jason P Linefsky 03/06/2015 09:37 PM Referring Physician: HALL, GAIRY F Performed By: Alan Carter
Administrative Closure: 03/06/2015 by: DEVICE PROXY SERVICE CLINICAL Clinical,Device Proxy Service
